item.title: ARCHITECT - .NET/CACHE (financial district)
item.description:
As a key contributor to the Coin and Currency Handling (CACHE) architecture team you will work with our external vendors, lines of business and internal hosting organizations on:
 Elaboration of business requirements.
 Application and infrastructure architecture/design of critical .NET based Cash processing application
 Integration of the application with SOA/J2EE based backend.
 Security framework for the integrated solution.

Position Requirements
 Excellent communication skills (oral and written) and strong analytical skills
 Expert level (5 years or more) experience designing and developing enterprise level applications using .NET and related technologies
 Prior experience in Java/J2EE preferably WebSphere Application Server
 Prior experience with XML, Web Services, SOAP and related standards and technologies
 Prior experience or knowledge of the several implementation options for SOA (e.g. with web services, an ESB and a registry / repository).
 Prior experience (or exposure to) designing services, and building technical infrastructures for Service Oriented Architectures (SOA).
 Ability to apply complex heterogeneous security technologies
 Ability to implement a clear and consistent technical vision for the project. Track and resolve issues where implementation deviates from technical vision/architecture
 Ability to provide oversight to application development project teams to fit systems to architecture, as well as to identify when it is necessary to modify the technical architecture to accommodate project needs
 Strong understanding of relational database design and development
 Prior structured application integration and middleware experience
 Prior experience in designing and implementing integration architectures for projects that require the participation and collaboration of cross-functional entities.
 Ability to work collaboratively, by coordinating among cross-functional internal and vendor teams for integration decisions and implementation. This will include the ability to cope with organizational differences and priorities.

Desirable Skills
 Prior experience with Windows Mobile 6.X
 Exposure to CMMI, SCRUM

To apply, please visit www.frbsf.org/federalreserve/careers and click on "Find a Job" to search for this and other dynamic opportunities.
